subject: Economics
title: AI Economics: The $15 Trillion Question
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: AI Economics: The $15 Trillion Question.

hook.text: PwC estimates AI will add $15.7 trillion to the global economy by 2030. That's more than the current GDP of China.

buildup.text: AI reduces costs, automates decisions, and creates new products.

discovery.text: AI's economic value concentrates in companies with data and talent. The US and China control 90% of AI investment.

twist.text: If AI substitutes labor at scale, economic output rises but wages fall. GDP grows while workers suffer.

climax.text: AI is the most consequential economic technology since industrialization.

punchline.text: AI will create trillions in value. The only question is: for whom?

quiz.question: What risk does AI pose to the economy even if it increases total output?
options: GDP can grow while wages fall if AI substitutes labor, concentrating gains among capital owners while workers suffer
